Allied Health Media

Virtual, work-from-home position. Work anywhere in the U.S. Must be a U.S. resident

We are growing! Become part of an IT team of 12 developers, business analysts, project managers, etc who support a company of 80 team members with industry-leading web applications in areas of continuing education, candidate screening, and much more.

ABOUT THE POSITION

We are seeking an extremely detailed and personable Web Application QA Analyst/Engineer to conduct and manage the testing of our web applications.

  • Full-time, salaried position
  • Regular hours are Mon-Fri 8a-5p Eastern or Central time
  • Work from your home office
  • Company-provided MacBook Pro and internet service stipend
  • Must be located in the United States and legally eligible to work in the US.
  • Travel is required for an annual company meeting (which is a lot of fun), and may be required a handful of times for team or project meetings

Responsibilities

  • Test web and mobile application releases on a day-to-day and project-by-project basis.
  • Develop and execute comprehensive testing plans for each project release.
  • Develop/implement automated test strategy and scripts.
  • Attend regular status meetings and deliver updates on testing progress.
  • Assist stakeholders in keeping application specifications accurate and up to date.
  • Work with IT Developers to improve automated testing where possible.
  • Work with project sponsors and product owners to improve daily testing regimens to ensure the websites are functioning at an optimal level.
  • Analyze documented defects to identify root cause and impact on related functions or product features.
  • Identify and mitigate risks / issues related to testing.
  • Suggest improvements, best practices, and new approaches to testing workflow (your voice will be heard).

We prefer a great/interested/excited tester with less experience to an unmotivated or unengaged tester with tons of experience.

TO APPLY

In your cover letter please include a description of the last couple of projects you’ve QA’d and your specific role in those projects, a link to your favorite movie clip on YouTube, and your salary requirements. Submissions without this information will not be considered.

ABOUT ALLIED HEALTH MEDIA

We are fast-paced, nimble, and laugh a lot. We all work from home offices in various locations across the country. We are dynamic, engaged, highly motivated and highly skilled. We are passionate about our work and our professions. For more information visit http://www.alliedhealthmedia.com.

Skills & Requirements

REQUIREMENTS

Self-management and time management are critical in this role. Without it, you will not be successful. Other requirements include:

  • 3+ years of testing experience: test planning and test execution.
  • Experience in an automated testing application such as Selenium or Cucumber.
  • Demonstrated experience testing large web applications.
  • Knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues.
  • Knowledge of how and where web applications fail - knowing how to break things!
  • Excellent communication skills - must be able to explain technical issues to a non-technical person and in a pleasant manner (we are always on Skype with stakeholders).
  • Highly attentive to detail - able to cross all the t's and dot all the i's at all times. Your success will depend on it.
  • There is direct oversight, but you are expected to take ownership of your work, to establish deadlines, and to communicate progress proactively.
  • Easygoing, fun, and a team player – must be able to comprehend highly-advanced forms of sarcasm.
  • Bachelor’s degree preferred.

About Allied Health Media

A leader in subscription-based online services, Allied Health Media (AHM) is comprised of passionate individuals dedicated to enhancing patient care. AHM is a privately held company currently comprised of: AudiologyOnline, SpeechPathology.com, PhysicalTherapy.com and OccupationalTherapy.com.

A ColdFusion Job That’s Actually Cool

$75k - 95k
Granbury Solutions

Job Description

You’ve spent most of your career working in ColdFusion.  You can see that the end is near and need an exit strategy.  We’re in the same boat.  We’re porting our winery software codebase from ColdFusion to a fancy new micro services architecture based on Spring Boot and Angular 2.  We’re looking for an experienced ColdFusion developer to help us with the ColdFusion side of the refactoring.  As the refactoring winds down, you’ll be cross trained and transition to working in Java/Spring or Angular 2 depending on your inclinations.

Any savvy ColdFusion developer these days knows the music is about to stop, so here’s the perfect chance to hit the ground running and prove your awesomeness with a technology you already know well, but learn the latest and greatest approaches to JVM based development along the way.  Within a few years, your ColdFusion days will be over and your career anxiety along with it.

You'll work with people who are as nice as they are smart.  You'll get the guidance you need and you won't be shamed when you stumble across a problem you don't know how to solve on your own.  You'll deal with a minimum of corporate nonsense and get the freedom to do things right.  

And you'll do all this from the comfort of your own home.  This is a remote position, but you'll keep in touch with your team with daily virtual standups.  We'll pick a spot on the map every so often and get together for a technical conference or in person design confab.  And free wine is a given.

Skills & Requirements

Required Qualifications

  • A bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
  • At least 5 years experience developing web applications in ColdFusion.
  • At least 5 years working with relational databases.
  • At least 2 years developing applications on Railo or Lucee.
  • Exposure to at least one modern Javascript SPA framework like Backbone, Ember, or Angular.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • A desire to do things right and the ability to take ownership of difficult problems.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Exposure to modern Java development with frameworks like Spring or Dropwizard.
  • Experience with a configuration management system like Chef, Puppet, Ansible or AWS Cloud Formation.
  • Exposure to a NoSQL database like MongoDB, Riak, Redis, or Couchbase.
  • Exposure to Memcached.
  • Enough experience with Agile development methodologies to see their strengths and weaknesses.
  • Payment card industry experience or experience building PCI compliant systems.
  • Experience with asynchronous messaging systems like MQ Series, JMS, or Rabbit MQ.
  • Experience with embedded development on Verifone or Ingenico payment devices. (Long shot, we know.)

 And you must have the right to work in the US legally.  Offshore applicants will not be considered.

About Granbury Solutions

We're Granbury Solutions.  We make software for malls, wineries, and yes, pizza shops.  Our vinSUITE product helps wineries nationwide (and Canada….and Australia) keep in touch with their customers and sell more wine through the entire customer lifecycle.

We work from home and we get together every day for a virtual stand up.  We go to at least one conference a year and we sometimes fly in for design sessions or project war rooms.  We try to take cool nerdy field trips.  Last time we went to the Hanford LIGO Observatory and saw how giant lasers can detect gravity waves.  It was cool.

items.title: Solutions Architect at EMS Software (Centennial, CO) (allows remote)
items.content:
Solutions Architect

$110k - 130k
EMS Software

Job Description

Leveraged by millions of user every day, EMS Software manages some of the highest profile spaces in the world (including the NASDAQ bell). We are consistently delivering new features to our suite of products. We want to tackle bigger challenges and accomplish some truly amazing things. Our team is always improving our codebase and operations footprint and we have amassed a sizeable backlog of interesting challenges and product initiatives. Our team needs to grow to enable even greater success in our industry, and that is where you come in.

We are looking for a Solutions Architect for our current application stack and our future platform services portfolio. This role requires hands-on project management skills, deep technical expertise, and excellent communication skills. Your broad responsibilities will include aiding in the technical engagement with our larger customers and with external partners and integrators, the ultimate success around specific implementation roll-out, developing a deep expertise in the complexities of Event Management Software, as well as a broad know-how around how applications and services are integrated within our platform services.

The ideal candidate will possess customer-facing skills that will allow them to represent EMS in interaction with partners and drive discussions with technical personnel within the company. They will also have a technical background that enables them to easily interact and give guidance with software developers and architects. They should have a demonstrated ability to think structurally about business, product, and technical challenges.

Your First 90 Days

In your first month, as your familiarity with the product grows, your responsibilities and influence will grow as well. You will start out shadowing our senior engineers on customer-facing technical calls. Concurrently, you will collaborate with members of the development team in establishing your knowledge base around the architecture and implementation of our product and the environments that they are implemented in. You will strive to become the “source of knowledge” around the non-functional characteristics of the products, with a particular focus on performance and security. You will represent this knowledge on customer troubleshooting calls, working with development team member to resolve customer performance issues. You will create your own sandbox environments where you will run focused experiments to come up with suggestions for improving the quality of our enterprise customer’s experience.

Within two months, you will be the technical lead on customer-facing calls. You will have helped to improve the documentation for configuration options for our customers and onboarding our partners/integrators while continuing to support them throughout their transition. When not working with customers and partners, you will work with our QE and Implementation Consultant team to better bench mark our product and refine the improvements that are needed to streamline the performance as well as implementation and maintenance of the product

Within three months,  you will work with product owners to drive changes to the operational and development roadmap as we inch closer to (i) moving our customers over to consuming our platform services and (ii) onboarding 40% of our customer base into managed services (SaaS) by the end of 2017.

Skills & Requirements

About You

  • You’re driven, humble, and autonomous
  • You’re a quick study, a strong communicator, and you’re able to adapt to a fast-paced environment
  • You have a working knowledge of Agile Development practices (e.g., SCRUM, TDD)
  • You have the following hands-on production experience
    • 3 years experience with windows (IIS, Exchange, AD, SQL Server)
    • 3 years experience setting up, maintaining and monitoring production environments
    • At least 2 years of experience working with networking infrastructure and monitoring at the application level
  • Performance optimization experience, including: troubleshooting and resolving network, server and database latency issues; performing hardware evaluation/selection tasks; performance vs cost vs time analysis
  • You’re detail-oriented, with excellent documentation skills, and you’re someone who can successfully manage multiple priorities
  • Troubleshooting skills that range from diagnosing hardware/software issues to large scale failures within a complex infrastructure
  • Experience in presenting and discussing to a large audience including customer Technical Consultant, CTO/CIO Level etc.

Other Things We Hope You Have  

  • Experience as a Developer
    • 2 years experience in .NET or equivalent
    • Working knowledge of JavaScript and Browser based development
    • Working knowledge of DB
  • Experience with Mobile Deployment in the Enterprise (Network configurations, Application wrapping, MDMs, etc.)
  • Experience with web and data security, including SSO Authentication (particularly OpenID, SAML, and Siteminder), data encryption strategies, and customer privacy issues.

The Team

The larger team consists of 13 Developers, 10 Quality Engineers, 3 DevOps, 4 Product Managers, and 3 UX Designers. Initially, you will report directly to the VP of Development, Assad Jarrahian.

We have an open and collaborative environment where everyone works together to deliver what is needed, from product features to operations needs (e.g., health checks).

We value open and direct communication, taking calculated risks that will push us forward, and investing in our people.

Our Stack

  • We have current Production and Continuous Integration footprints in Google Cloud, AWS, and Azure
  • Our front end applications leverage React and React Native, Redux, Node, C# and Knockout
  • Our APIs comprise of Golang, .NET and .NET core
  • Our backend comprises of MS SQL Server

About EMS Software

EMS Software helps millions of people create great meetings. AIG, Yale University, Accenture, and thousands of others rely on EMS Software to increase productivity, attract and retain people, reduce costs, and differentiate their brand. EMS Software offers the greatest depth and breadth of functionality, the fastest and easiest way to schedule a meeting, and an exceptional customer experience.

*How We Work*

We believe in, and practice, the lean startup ideas of build/measure/learn, and will be very happy to show you the kanban storyboard you will be building from. You will participate in, and often lead, our retrospectives, as well as presenting at the fortnightly showcases, to the wider team, which are essential for ensuring we are all on the same page.

We typically start with a workshop to define what we need to achieve, leading to wireframes and perhaps some high level tasks. We refine and test until we believe we have the core of what we want and then we build the smallest amount we can to validate this - sometimes in code, sometimes in prototype.

We do regular user testing, rapid prototyping and code spikes to ensure we only build the most-right thing we can right now. Darius was Head of UX (ThoughtWorks) and Head of Product (Isotrak) so agile product management and user experience are truly in our blood.


*What we're looking for...*

You, of course - a talented community manager - but we’re hoping you’ll bring much more than that. You’ll...

*Be an excellent communicator* - As the conduit to our customer community, in many ways you are the face of our brand. We think you’ll need to be a master communicator, able to assess, and engage, with audiences. You're a journalistic chameleon, able to craft a well written long-form article with professional flair, yet also communicate concepts through a string of simple, creative, words (and emoji). All in our tone of voice and with sincerity and authenticity.

*Take it offline* - We think community management at Wrisk will go beyond the online world. You'll be comfortable interacting with people offline too – you can walk into a room full of strangers and leave with them all wanting to be part of Wrisk!

*Have (some) design skills* - Content that engages often goes beyond the written word in isolation. We have some great design talent here already to support you, but you should also be comfortable producing supporting media to bring our messages to life.

*Display good judgment* - You can parse the content coming out of our organization and determine what, how, and when, to share. You’ll also be our guide as to the best way to handle feedback from the audience (the negative as well as the positive), and guide us in how to respond in an appropriate fashion.

*Have empathy and emotional intelligence* - Our community is likely to contain a bunch of different personalities. You can see the Wrisk brand from every perspective, and use this to guide your engagements. Insurance might seem dull until you need to make a claim, when emotions will be running very high. What we offer only truly becomes valuable during times of frustration, vulnerability and loss.

*Be dedicated and committed* - Startups don’t run to the normal nine to five, and neither will our community.

*Be highly organised* - Engagement occurs across multiple platforms and you can maintain conversations across all threads of activity. This will probably include scheduling content creation effectively, tracking and measuring feedback, and working out what works (and what doesn’t). You'll also need great organisation (and patience!) to extract content from our wider team; We all love what we do, but we aren’t all as great as you are, at talking about it!

*Understand the importance of analytics and measurement* - To figure out which things are working and which aren’t, we employ the lean cycle of build, measure and learn. You can help us collectively define and measure the effectiveness of our campaigns in a similar way. There is often a difference in what people say and what they do - we need your eagle-eye for metrics so we can figure out what is actually going on.

*Be an enabler for our community* - A community is not a one-way communications channel - we want genuine conversations so our audience’s voice is heard. We need people to become enthusiastic fans, and even co-creators, so we need to find creative ways to empower and reward them.

*Be as passionate as the rest of us* - Passion and interest are not words typically associated with insurance, but you’ll be excited about the opportunity to affect change (just like us).

*Embrace, and cultivate, our culture* - We take culture pretty seriously at Wrisk - but it’s especially important for our community manager, as you’ll so often be representing our company personality to our customers.

*What you'll do...*

* Become the company storyteller. Documenting the journey of our team and product through writing, images, video and anything else that might connect with our audience.

* Set and implement your social media and communication campaigns to align with marketing strategies.

* Help us clarify the drivers that trigger people to swap insurance providers (and figure out how to reach prospects in each state before that point).

* Respond to community and customer queries in a timely and effective way.

* Organize and participate in events to build community and boost brand awareness.

* Act as the connector between the wider team and the community. Making sure to to stay updated on new product features and share feedback, questions etc.

* Build relationships with customers, potential customers, industry professionals and journalists.

* Encourage the wider team to contribute to the community and also help in the creation of specialist content.


*About you...*

Some technical skills you'll be able to demonstrate…

* The ability to bring together and engage our community across a variety of different channels including, but not solely, news publications, blogs, social media and face-to-face.

* Social media expertise with sites like LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram (and be able to share knowledge about the pros and cons of different platforms).

* Experience with setting up campaigns to advertise (with measurement and reporting of results) and optimising on key platforms, such as Facebook

* Being able to work smartly - using a whole host of tools (e.g. Buffer, Quuu, Backly, Discourse, or whatever you favour).


If you want to be part of the team but you don’t quite fit the bill get in touch anyway.

_Passion beats skills every time._

We firmly believe in equal opportunities for all.
We offer a competitive salary, generous holiday, and flexible working conditions.

We're currently at Tech Hub, Moorgate, part of Google for Entrepreneurs. As you would expect, it comes with the obligatory ping pong table, foosball table and free coffee, plus regular talks from luminaries of the startup and tech sector.

Want to know more?

Drop us a line and send us:

* A link to learn more about you (your LinkedIn, your CV, etc.)
* Three things you would change about this job posting (typos, new requirements... anything, really)
* A sentence or two about why insurance sucks right now

items.title: Performance Marketing Manager
items.content:
Founded in May 2015, Papier is a fast-growing, Soho-based start-up, which has raised £3.5 million since launch and is changing the face of online personalisation. Papier offers a sophisticated user experience and delivers beautifully designed products, on-demand and all over the world, from personalised greeting cards to wedding invitations and stationery.

Papier is looking for an analytical, data-driven individual to drive growth through digital marketing channels. Joining a small but highly motivated team, the position is integral in taking Papier to the next level, building on the rapid success it has achieved to date.

The position will report into the CEO and Marketing Director.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES

* Budget, execute, optimise and report on digital marketing channels (SEO, PPC, display and paid social media) to achieve business goals
* New customer acquisition: Generating quality leads with strong ROIs and within CPA targets
* Provide clear performance reporting and deliver insights to inform future marketing decisions
* Scale digital marketing across new channels and to new territories globally
* Work with Marketing & Creative Directors to generate effective ads that are aligned with brand voice and aesthetic
* Execute and measure A/B tests across marketing channels
* Manage relationships with third parties/agencies as required

REQUIREMENTS

* Highly analytical, data-driven and logical mind-set. Ability to make clear objective decision informed by data with a test and learn approach
* 2+ years online marketing experience (preferably in a B2C / e-commerce experience)
* Familiarity with AdWords and Facebook Advertising, as well as BingAds and other social platforms
* Ability to work with and analyse large data sets as well as conversion tracking tools
* Willing to take calculated risks that will drive business growth, using innovative and analytical thinking and creative growth strategies
* Keen interest in and awareness of the latest trends and best practices in online marketing
* Highly proficient in Excel
* Proficiency in Photoshop a bonus
* Experience in optimising landing pages and user funnels a bonus

Direct applications only - no recruiters please.
Address your application to Sophie and include a brief summary of why you think you’d be great for the role!

items.title: Performance Marketer
items.content:
We’re a high growth start-up shaking up the billion pound men’s grooming market using clever technology, quality products and a super-smart team.

Over the last 2 years we’ve grown our team from 1 to 25 and built a customer base of 125,000 loyal members. We can only keep up that kind of growth rate if we continue to hire great people. That’s where you come in!

We work in a great office in central London, with beer and prosecco on tap, and nearly unlimited biscuits. We’re a highly-motivated and friendly team, and like to celebrate the successes we achieve with a few drinks or a London landmark. How to apply: Please send us your CV along with a covering email explaining why you’d like to come and work with us!

Performance Marketer

Cornerstone is seeking an ambitious Performance Marketer to join our leading marketing team. You’ll help drive growth of Cornerstone through taking ownership of key marketing channels & supporting cross-channel analysis and wider marketing strategy.

We're focused on improving data-driven decision making across all aspects of customer acquisition and retention. You’ll be a self-starter and confident in tackling a multiple of channels in a dynamic environment. You are also interested in developing the skills and frameworks necessary to solving complex analytical problems in a growth stage company.

You will support the Head of Acquisition & primarily work on new customer acquisition via online channels; including PPC, display and other performance channels. You will also work on customer segmentation and product analyses focused on improving on-site performance, improving customer AOV and scoping potential future business opportunities.
You are a technically-minded, strong analytic thinker and problem solver who has built a knowledge of the do’s and don’ts of digital performance growth marketing. Most importantly, you are an entrepreneurial and flexible marketer who is excited to help us develop a world-class digital marketing experience & product at Cornerstone.

THE ROLE
-Take immediate ownership of acquisition channels including PPC and display, with the ability to scale fast
-Uncover new pockets of growth in targeting users across existing and new channels
-Support growth initiatives within Cornerstone that could increase existing conversion and retention
-Work directly with Head of Acquisition and lifetime marketing/on-site optimization teams to implement key testing efforts in a timely manner
-Be inquisitive as to developments within ecommerce & marketing and be confident to advocate and own new marketing campaigns
-Move fast in a “test and learn” environment

THE CANDIDATE
-BA/BSc degree and 2+ years of experience in digital marketing, data analytics, and e-commerce (ideally within an e-commerce start-up)
-Experience taking ownership of performance-driven digital acquisition channels – PPC & display a must (paid social & affiliate marketing a plus)
-Within key channels of experience (PPC & display) have a passion for test and learn, understanding inside out the mechanics that drive strong campaigns & experience of using learned best practice or hacks to scale campaigns
-Experience in working with web analytics tools (such as GA) and analyzing relevant data such as traffic, bounce rates and user flows
-Ability to analyze data, model and understand user problems to identify key opportunities for improvement
-Creative Problem Solver – Analytics means finding creative ways to answer vague problems. You should be able to find creative ways to solve problems
-Strong work ethic, intellectual curiosity, and commitment to continuous improvement
-Ability to take initiative and focus on independent work, whilst working well with teams
-Have a sense of humour, be positive and ambition to learn and develop

Competitive salary

items.title: PR Manager
items.content:
OpenSignal is seeking a Public Relations (PR) Manager to continue to grow the OpenSignal brand as an independent standard in the wireless industry. OpenSignal has a significant track record of achieving frequent and major PR for its regular industry reports, it’s mobile apps and it’s thought leadership in the wireless industry and is looking for someone to take ownership of these efforts going forward. The PR Manager will be tasked with developing and executing an effective communications and media relations plan and the right candidate will have the ability to build and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with key stakeholders, a high level of credibility and be a motivated, self-starter. Knowledge of telecommunications and mobile industry is advantageous as is experience in a startup.


Key responsibilities:
Lead and manage the day-to-day running of the PR for OpenSignal, including reactive media relations
Take ownership of PR for OpenSignal’s regular schedule of industry reports and all other PR activities including the launching of new consumer apps or updates.
Take the lead on managing relationships with OpenSignal’s many press contacts built up over 6 years.
Developing a marketing/PR communications plan including strategy, goals, budget and tactics
Developing a media relations strategy, seeking high-level placements in print, broadcast and online media
Monitor, analyze and communicate PR results on a regular basis

Skills:
PR expert - a track record in managing PR activities for a brand with a demonstrable understanding of how to maximise PR coverage and headlines.
Knowledgeable about current activities in the media and mobile/telecom industry and ability to link the two on short notice for maximum PR benefit
Ensure PR activity delivers against business objectives and articulates key messages
Complete end-to-end media monitoring and outreach with an ability to form new, meaningful media relationships quickly (being reactive and proactive)
Organised and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Adaptable and excited to work in a fast-paced startup environment
Exceptional writing and editing skills


Basic Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree.
Several years in an agency/in-house working at a manager level

Preferred Qualifications
Able to work quickly and have a track record of delivery on major campaigns, a high level of creativity and extensive experience in dealing with media contacts and international news desks.
Extensive experience in dealing with high-level consumer media contacts across news and broadcast sectors
Experience or understanding of the telecom industry
Good presentation skills

items.title: Event Manager & Personal Assistant
items.content:
A unique opportunity to become the first employee at an influential networking group within the education sector.

If you’re an extremely organised, entrepreneurial and hardworking individual, then this is the role for you!

EdTech Exchange is a networking group for education technology leaders. You will act as a Personal Assistant to the CEO as well as being the Event Manager: organising weekly dinners, quarterly drinks parties and numerous conferences.

The role includes:

* Event management (dinners and drinks parties)
* Conference management (organising a few conferences annually)
* Social media (promoting our news and our members’ news, and engaging with the wider edtech community)
* Communications (our weekly members’ newsletter and monthly newsletter to the wider edtech community)
* Marketing and sales (identifying potential new members and leading them through the onboarding process)
* Calendar management (arranging meetings, booking restaurants, travel etc)
* Business admin (general administration including expenses, invoicing, etc)

We’re looking for someone who:

* is motivated and a self-starter, requiring minimal direction
* is extremely organised and comfortable dealing with large volumes of admin and tasks
* has fantastic communication skills with excellent English
* has administration/assistant experience
* has some experience of event management
* can attend meetings and events in central London (at least once a week)

You’ll be the company’s first employee and have the ability to shape the direction of the business. You’ll report directly to the CEO. You may work from home or from a central London co-working space.

items.title: Product Manager - Chemical Specialist
items.content:
We are looking for a Product Management professional who lives to delight the customer, thrives in a fast pace, collaborative environment and loves B2B SaaS technology.

This role is to own and develop a business facing Chemical SaaS product, driving the development from inception to execution. This is a new role in an entirely new team, so we are looking for someone who can help instill a passion for product and customer experience across PatSnap.

You will be working with a wide range of stakeholders and customers to fully understand the scope of the problem that you are looking to solve. Once you have figured out the ‘why’ and the ‘what’ of a problem, you can translate this into set of user stories and acceptance criteria for developers and designers to work on. You are extremely entrepreneurial and can help innovate and execute product initiatives across the company.

Key Responsibilities:

Be the expert on our customers’ needs.

Understand our competitors, and the market landscape.

Help us figure out the right product to build.

Help us identify new products we should be building.

Together with UX, design, engineering, R&D, QA--and most importantly, our customers--deliver the best product that meets our customers’ needs, with a world-class experience.

Help sales, marketing, account management, and customer support, get our product into the hands of customers, and keep them happy.

Skills/Qualifications:

Background in the Chemical Product Management is a must for this role.
Able to communicate effectively; you’ll need to work across almost every team in the company.
You’re a team player; you understand that it takes a team to do great things.
Excellent prioritization skills; you recognize that there is always limited resource and that includes your time.
You sweat the details.
You don’t lose sight of the big picture.
You’re the eye of the storm; you’re comfortable with uncertainty, and stay calm in the midst of chaos. Your team looks to you.
You’re methodical and excellent at problem solving; you’ll be doing lots of this.
You don’t need to know how to code, but you do need a good-enough understanding of web technologies.
Basic user research and UX know-how, or the ability to learn fast.
Bonus: you’ve taken a product from concept to launch to optimization.
If this job sounds like something you’d love to do every day, we definitely want to hear from you. We need to hear from you!

items.title: Project Manager (Product/Engineering)
items.content:
About us

Founded in 2010, Checkout.com is an international FinTech company providing end-to-end ecommerce solutions for payments on the Internet. Built on 100% proprietary technology Checkout.com’s online platform offers all credit and debit cards as well as alternative and local payment methods through a single integration. With clients such as Deliveroo, Virgin, Adidas and many more, Checkout.com’s 120+ talented team members serve a list of true tier one global retailers and leading mobile applications from its London, Dubai, Singapore and Mauritius offices.

At Checkout.com we strive to create a unique working environment where each of our employees are empowered to take their responsibilities, solve complex puzzles and deliver value accretive solutions for the Company. We believe an individual maximum yield can only be achieved through a dynamic corporate culture that focuses on personal growth and fully tailored career development paths.

This experience is offered in a fast paced and innovation-focused office space ideally located in the heart of London.

About the role

Checkout.com is actively seeking a resourceful Project Manager with a can-do attitude to join our Engineering Team and deliver a set of initiatives to improve the capability of our people, the efficiency of our products and the scalability of our Company.

Working side by side with various Developers, Product owners and collaborating with many business stakeholders internally, the Project Manager will work on a range of projects to enhance our Product Development environment. In this role, you will juggle with short-term deliverables (e.g. new product features development) and long-term goals (e.g. new methodologies and processes implementation), focusing on immediate needs at hand and visualising the bigger picture. You will act as our process champion and ensure that projects are delivered against commitments, managing their timeline and dependencies.

You will be responsible for owning projects across their entire lifecycle:

Lead requirements gathering and definition with business stakeholders and product owners
Ensure the scope of work is clearly defined and document everything
Communicate project status and plans, and manage dependencies
Highlight, report and manage project risks & issues
Coordinate Engineering resourcing and timescales

About you

5+ years hands-on Technical Project Management experience in a fast-paced and high growth environment, ideally in the e-commerce/FinTech industry.
Exposure to and understanding of a range of software development life-cycle methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, SCRUM, Kanban, etc)
Experience of tools such as JIRA, Microsoft Project, Confluence and Github
Excellent organisation skills, ability to adhere to deadlines whilst maintaining a high quality of delivery
Superb communication skills, ability to interact effectively with multidisciplinary people at all levels across the organisation
Experience working with remote teams is a plus
Recognised Project Management qualification is a plus


Checkout.com is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience, skills and personality. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

Due to the numerous amount of application received, only the ones corresponding to this job profile will be contacted. If you have not been contacted within 3 weeks please deem your application as unsuccessful.

items.title: Business Analyst
items.content:
Who we are

Altus Group is a leading provider of software, data solutions, and independent advisory services to the global commercial real estate industry. Our businesses, Altus Analytics and Altus Expert Services, empower clients to analyse, gain market insight and recognise value on their real estate investments. Headquartered in Canada, we have approximately 2,300 employees around the world, with operations in North America, Europe and Asia Pacific.

The opportunity

Reporting to the Technical Product Manager, we need a Business Analyst to join our Altus Analytics team and work on an essential internal client product. Someone who can focus on analyzing data, reporting and workflow management. This is an opportunity for a BA to gain direct experience working closely with Development and Product Management, owning and driving the development of features.

Who you are - and how you can grow your career here

You are an Analyst or a Consultant with experience translating requirements into specifications for a B2B software company, ideally within the CRE or Financial industry. You have a passion for bridging the needs of users with the functions of technology. You are excited to own and drive features across both the reporting and workflow tools. You want to join a rapidly scaling company where you can gain exposure and expertise to new technologies and grow into a senior BA working on external-facing products or move into technical product management.

What you will do

•Start conversations and probe for details. You can efficiently elicit and validate requirements.
•Design solutions. You can produce functional and non-functional specification documentation incorporating text, mock-ups and wireframes for any and every level of audience.
•Analyse. You can gather relevant data, perform an analysis based on specifications and create reports for the product and development teams.
•Create. You can piece together logical workflows based on user information, requirements and your understanding of both the processes and the technology.
•Drive. You investigate issues thoroughly and create practical solutions that solve problems and open up new opportunities. You are always looking for ways to improve processes, and you always ensure your communications have been received and are clearly understood.
•Collaborate. You enjoy working with other BAs and across departments as part of a product team.
•Own it. You take pride in ensuring that the product delivers real value to our internal customers and satisfies all criteria. You want to take responsibility for large and complex projects with minimal supervision.
What we are looking for
•The right combination of education and experience. You have a technical or finance university degree. You have experience working as an Analyst or Consultant on internal or external software development projects.
•An analytical mindset. You can quickly understand and analyse various approaches and processes instantly. You have the ability to drill down to the details, obtaining the right level of specificity for your development team and you enjoy the detailed nature of report documentation.
•A balance of technical understanding and people-facing skills. You understand and are interested in business process modelling notation. You can define and understand the benefits and the limitations of a system. You are able to document the functional and the technical requirements of an end user.
•Empathy. You can put yourself in the shoes of an end-user or co-worker and take the necessary steps to enable their success.
•Ambition. You meet the challenges of the day with energy, enthusiasm and drive.
•A genuine interest in new tools and technology. You learn new software quickly without documentation or handholding.
•A team oriented personality. Your commitment and focus influences those around you to do better. You gain satisfaction when the team wins.
•An outstanding communication style. You have a way of speaking to people on any level, so they understand even the most complicated presentation. You know how to leverage communication tools and methodologies.

Need any more reasons to want to work with us?

As we continue to grow, the possibilities for the people that join Altus Analytics are significant. From professional growth to innovation to collaboration we are committed to continuing to foster the right environment to help our people realise their full potential. We give our people the freedom and responsibility to take charge of their career path, bring new ideas to the forefront and work on critical projects that will shape the success of our clients.

We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to spend time doing some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what’s new by following us on LinkedIn.

items.title: City Manager (Leeds / Edinburgh / Manchester)
items.content:
“The App that’s changing the way we use restaurants”
Daily Telegraph, December 2016

A unique opportunity for an ambitious, entrepreneurial business developer looking to join a fast-growing foodtech startup. London-based CityMunch is planning to launch in Edinburgh, Manchester and Leeds in the coming months, and is looking for one local head per city to drive the launch.

You will be an “entrepreneur with backing” – sharing in the both the risks and rewards of the business. You will build out our relationships with our restaurant partners, launch a marketplace product, and help drive our consumer marketing efforts, with the backing, training and direct assistance of the team in London. In the short term, you will be our sole representative based in your city, developing relationships with restaurant partners and helping them make best use of the CityMunch platform.

You will be:

• An independent self-starter. The role will require a significant amount of unsupervised work, and as such needs someone who can manage their own time.
• A natural relationship-builder. Much of the role will consist of developing new and existing relationships with restaurants and the wider food community.
• Well-organised, keeping CRM database up to date and project managing events around the city.
• Marketing-focussed. Part of the role will be marketing related, including managing local social media accounts and developing relationships with local marketing partners.
• An entrepreneur in the making, with strong work experience and proven leadership skills.

The perks:

• Work closely with the CEO and Head of Business Development, and learn the ropes of how to develop a startup in a new city.
• Autonomy. This is a rare chance to truly push yourself, and see how far you can take a business on your own steam.
• Be part of the early stages of a high-growth tech startup, and help set its future course.
• Training in London’s TechHub @ Campus, part of Google’s Campus building in Tech City.
• Work with a smart, engaged (and fun!) team.
• A generous profit-sharing arrangement, plus a full-time salary – you will have a direct share in the progress you make.

About CityMunch

• CityMunch launched in London in March 2016, with the goal of bringing efficiency to the restaurant industry through targeted, real-time discounts
• CityMunch is one of the startups championing the “anti-uber” business model, and has been called “the app that’s changing the way we use restaurants”
• CityMunch is backed by Just Eat, and raised money from the crowd via Seedrs

items.title: Event Sales Manager
items.content:
MVF is a global customer generation business supplying some of the world’s leading brands with high volumes of new customers in over 120 countries. In 2013, MVF topped the Sunday Times Tech Track as the fastest growing tech company in the UK, and this year was also named the business with the 50th fastest growing profits in the UK. We are on a mission to accelerate our clients’ growth by building the world’s most effective marketing platform through a passion for data, relentless innovation and the development of world class teams. We want you to help get us there!

People join us to change the industry, work with world class talent, develop their careers and become part of our remarkable culture.  

Want a sales role where you can flex your creative muscles, coming up with innovative ideas that your clients can rave about?  

Our Team

* Able to work under pressure and to meet deadlines Ability to learn quickly and to be proactive

* Unlimited Book Allowance
* Charity Days
* Free food and fruit throughout the day
* Relaxed, informal culture - no dress code
* Hours 9-5 Monday-Friday - they promote a work/life balance culture
* Monthly companywide lunches
* Gaming and book clubs
* Sports clubs including Football, Running, Volleyball, and Cycling
* Corporate gym membership
* Cycle to work scheme
* Childcare vouchers
* Family First culture
* Regular social nights out
* Trips to Ibiza for all staff on achieving annual targets

If you have a true passion for sales and would enjoy seeing startups grow and benefit as a result of the events you connect them with, then please apply.

items.title: IoT Solution Architect (m/f)

Are you interested in leading IoT implementation strategies?

Then relayr is the right place for you!

At relayr, we are building the future of IoT. Our team of smart creatives combine software, hardware and big thinking to make other people’s powerpoint decks reality. But, all of this energy is useless without an architectural vision.

relayr is looking for Professional Services Solution Architect to join our fast growing delivery team in Berlin. You will be a part of an expanding, successful business that is having a major impact on the IoT market. You will work with some of the most exciting customers throughout Germany, Europe and the world to help them define and implement their IoT vision.

Building customer-specific IoT architectures together with the relayr extended team
Analyzing functionality, scalability and security of innovative IoT solutions
Defining optimal ways of integration between relayr cloud- and gateway-based software products as well as third-party hardware and software
Define and control technical project tasks for hardware and software development teams, including both relayr and subcontractor ones
Create and execute implementation, migration and test plans
Build lasting customer relationships and partnerships with IoT decision-makers across the industry

Understanding of IoT with ability to explain different use cases and their benefits
Strong and demonstrable understanding of network, security and cloud platform solutions and architecture design
Proven experience developing and delivering effective technical presentations
Basic knowledge of industrial technologies and protocols
Basic software development skills in Java, JavaScript/Node.js, C and automation scripting languages (python, perl, shell, etc.)
Ability to work with a variety of different technical teams as well as third parties
You are self-sufficient with a high degree of autonomy and a passion for working in start-up environment
A team player with the ability to work in complex cross-functional teams
BSc in Computer Science or a related field is a plus

*Product Analyst*
Base & Equity
Shoreditch, London

*Curve is growing - join our adventurous startup!*

Our team of award winning (voted leading startup at the EPAwards ‘16 and included in Tech City’s Upscale ‘17 startup programme) entrepreneurs, product-builders and customer-focused marketers are developing a ground-breaking product with the customer at the core. With funding from the Who’s Who in angel investors and an experienced and ambitious founding team, we are at the forefront of London FinTech.

You’ll be an integral part of the Product team that owns the end-to-end experience, from onboarding to day-to-day transactions, the mobile apps and every touchpoint and interaction a user has with Curve. Our business rests on data, and we use data to inform and evaluate our decisions on a constant basis.

With the wealth of data you’ll have the ability to refine the product and user journeys, and create new insights to drive new experiences and opportunities to benefit the end user

*What you'll be doing:*

*Product*
* set up A/B and multivariate tests, define success metrics, and track their performance
* build and improve analytic capability of the product, allowing data to inform product direction and features decisions
* run ad-hoc analyses that will help move the needle on our top KPIs

* you’ll go beyond quantitative data and qualitatively gather information from users (call/email/survey/interview)

items.title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
items.content:
_Company Description:_

Anomali delivers earlier detection and identification of adversaries in your organization’s network by making it possible to correlate tens of millions of threat indicators against your real time network activity logs and up to a year or more of forensic log data. Anomali’s approach enables detection at every point along the kill chain, making it possible to mitigate threats before any material damage to your organization has occurred.

_Position Description:_

Threat Intelligence Analysts work as part of our Professional Services team that partners with Anomali customers. Responsibilities range from analyst support to account onboarding and product training to delivering product solutions to acting as the “voice of the customer” for our product management and development teams.

Anomali already supports information security teams at some of the most ambitious organizations on the planet. Your days will be spent working closely with those customers to ensure they are effectively using our intelligence services to secure and positively impact business operations.

You will be a problem-solving expert discussing new security technology with top companies and serving as the liaison between Anomali and our customers. You must be passionate about technology and a great customer experience as well as building a world-class security business.

_Responsibilities:_

* Manage the technical aspect of accounts from the moment they become customers. You will be the customer's champion and guide to using Anomali for threat intelligence.
* Provide analyst support for quick hit product requests as well as formal research reports and customer briefings on threat topics.
* Understand each customer’s unique threat intelligence goals and field technical product questions supporting analyst teams.
* Develop and deliver product configurations that fulfil intelligence requirements according to customer workflows.
* Manage activities across multiple clients including account reviews, onsite product configuration/training, and analyst support to ensure customer success.
* Drive user adoption of Anomali solutions as well as communicate customer requirements and product successes/failures across the organization.
* Acquire complete command of Anomali products (ThreatStream 6.0, Anomali Enterprise, Anomali Link, etc)
* Occassionally support large and strategic customer pre-sales activities
* Serve as a coach and trusted advisor to large and strategic Anomali customers
* Derive and disseminate threat intelligence best practices to help drive customer adoption of Anomali products and services
* Provide feedback to product management based on field experiences
* Work closely with our exceptional security engineers and data scientists in Anomali Labs to drive technical requirements for new prototype and tool development.
* Enhance security tradecraft to identify threats before the adversaries have a strong foothold in organizations.

_Required Skills/Experience:_

* BA/BS or equivalent combination of education and experience
* 2+ years of experience as an Intelligence or Information Security Analyst.
* Experience working and communicating directly with clients
* Strong troubleshooting, presentation, and consultative skills
* Comfortable speaking technically with analysts and strategically with senior executives
* Strong project management skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Strong technical background and ability to speak to engineers, developers and end users
* Knowledge of enterprise level businesses and inner IT workings
* Understanding of terminology and tactics employed by threat actors
* Experience scripting in Python or other scripting language to enable threat research, malware analysis, or other security-related tasks

_Bonus Skills/Experience:_

* Knowledge of how malware is developed, functions, and is employed
* Ability to extract technical indicators from malware and/or pcap via tools
* Has presented at a security or hacking conference.
* Has an active threat intelligence related blog
* Has contributed to or released a security tool as open source software
* Enjoys collaborating and sharing information with the broader security community
* Experience writing YARA/Snort signatures
* Prior experience working in startups
* Experience with ArcSight, Splunk, IBM QRadar, McAfee Nitro, and/or Hadoop

_Travel:_

Predominately EMEA. Travel may include but not limited to: customer locations, local user groups, user conferences events, and corporate events.

_Comp Plan:_

Base plus corporate compensation package
